p: Sending SMS has been significantly used in the health area, mainly to improve quality of life and attendance in primary care, and to reduce non-adherence and improve health results at low cost, as well as the possibility of wide dissemination of information in real time for the entire target population of the intervention ( 8 , 13 - 14 , 18 - 19 , 29 ). Additionally, the use of SMS reminders is an accessible, adequate, and more cost-effective tool compared to those already spent on medication ( 26 , 30 - 31 ). In this way, there are basically four types of benefits of interventions performed by SMS: (1) improved efficiency in the provision of health care; (2) improvement in treatment adherence; (3) public health benefits; (4) low cost and good accessibility ( 19 , 26 , 28 , 30 - 31 ).
